page.title: 11BANCHORY-DEVENICK HOUSES
page.content: In Banchory-Devenick most of the houses were built before the{1940's although some new houses are being built. The most common amount of rooms in a house is between five and eight. { Most people now own their house instead of renting it. Most of the houses in Banchory-Devenick are built of{granite and cement with slate {roofs.}The most popular type of heating is a{coal fire}but now some people are putting in gas central heating or electric instead. The old houses were farm houses and cottages but these have been sold off or rented out. Most have been extended and{modernised and every one has a {bathroom.}Many of the houses in Banchory_Devenick have{very big {gardens.
